original_solution_mapping.L1: 40% of the 100 studio audience will have an envelope under their chair so .40*100 = <<100*.40=40>>40 people will find an envelope
original_solution_mapping.L2: 20% of these 40 people will find a "You Won" notice so only .20*40 = <<.20*40=8>>8 people will win

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7028.
    Returns: the number of people who will win a prize.
    """
    # L1
    total_audience = 100 # 100 people
    envelope_percent_decimal = 0.40 # 40% of these people
    people_with_envelope = envelope_percent_decimal * total_audience

    # L2
    win_percent_decimal = 0.20 # 20% of these people
    winners = win_percent_decimal * people_with_envelope

    # FA
    answer = winners
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: 40% of the {total_audience} studio audience will have an envelope under their chair so {envelope_percent_decimal}*{total_audience} = <<{total_audience}*{envelope_percent_decimal}={people_with_envelope}>>{people_with_envelope} people will find an envelope

20% of these {people_with_envelope} people will find a "You Won" notice so only {win_percent_decimal}*{people_with_envelope} = <<{win_percent_decimal}*{people_with_envelope}={winners}>>{winners} people will win

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: 40% of the 100 studio audience will have an envelope under their chair so 100*100 = <<100*100=10000>>10000 people will find an envelope
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: 20% of these 10000 people will find a "You Won" notice so only 0.2*10000 = <<0.2*10000=2000>>2000 people will win

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_audience' (100) was used instead of 'envelope_percent_decimal' (0.4).
